questions.question_text: What function, combined with the copy command, should be used to unload data from a relational table into a JSON file?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

D is correct:
Unloading a relational table to JSON
You can use the OBJECT_CONSTRUCT function combined with the COPY command to convert the rows in a relational table to a single VARIANT column and unload the rows into a file.
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-unload-considerations

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of a directory table in Snowflake?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct that's the purpose of directory tables

Selected Answer: D
A directory table is an implicit object layered on a stage that stores file-level metadata about the data files in the stage, similar conceptually to an external table
You can query a directory table to retrieve a list of all the files on a stage. The query output contains information about each file, including the size, last modified timestamp, and the file URL
Directory tables store data file metadata

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-load-dirtablesThe key points are:

choices.C: To manage user privileges and access control
choices.A: To store actual data from external stages
choices.D: To store file-level metadata about data files in a stage
choices.B: To automatically expire file URLs for security

questions.question_text: Which Snowflake table objects can be shared with other accounts? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
BD - UDTFs must be secure

Selected Answer: BD
"Secure Data Sharing lets you share selected objects in a database in your account with other Snowflake accounts. You can share the following Snowflake objects:
Databases
Tables
Dynamic tables
External tables
Iceberg tables
Secure views
Secure materialized views
Secure user-defined functions (UDFs)"

Selected Answer: BD
BD
You can share tables and external tables, although I cannot find info whether you can share temporary or transient tables.
For sure it is BD, I do not know about transient tables.
The Correct Answer is B C

questions.question_text: Which metadata table will store the storage utilization information even for dropped tables?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/info-schema/table_storage_metrics

Selected Answer: B
"This view (TABLE_STORAGE_METRICS) displays table-level storage utilization information, which is used to calculate the storage billing for each table in the account, including tables that have been dropped, but are still incurring storage costs."

Selected Answer: B
TABLE_STORAGE_METRICS View:

This view displays table-level storage utilization information, which is used to calculate the storage billing for each table in the account, including tables that have been dropped, but are still incurring storage costs.

questions.question_text: How is role hierarchy established in Snowflake?

choices.B: By default when a role is created
choices.D: By transferring ownership of one role to another role
choices.C: By granting one role to another role

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the principle of parent child

Selected Answer: C
"Granting a role to another role creates a “parent-child” relationship between the roles (also referred to as a role hierarchy)."
